trans-unit.source: provides two kinds of identity, system-wide identity and database-specific identity.

seg-source.mrk: provides two kinds of identity, system-wide identity and database-specific identity.

target.mrk: provides two kinds of identity, system-wide identity and database-specific identity.

trans-unit.source: System-wide identity: Currently, any legal system-wide identity enjoys authorization to perform the following operations:

seg-source.mrk: System-wide identity: Currently, any legal system-wide identity enjoys authorization to perform the following operations:

target.mrk: System-wide identity: Currently, any legal system-wide identity enjoys authorization to perform the following operations:

trans-unit.source: Database-specific identity: If you are a legal identity in a specific database, you may enjoy the following rights:

seg-source.mrk: Database-specific identity: If you are a legal identity in a specific database, you may enjoy the following rights:

target.mrk: Database-specific identity: If you are a legal identity in a specific database, you may enjoy the following rights:

trans-unit.source: You can connect to that database, provided that coarse-grained connection authorization has not been set to noAccess.

seg-source.mrk: You can connect to that database, provided that coarse-grained connection authorization has not been set to noAccess.

target.mrk: You can connect to that database, provided that coarse-grained connection authorization has not been set to noAccess.

trans-unit.source: You can shut down that database, encrypt it, and upgrade it, provided that you are the database owner.

seg-source.mrk: You can shut down that database, encrypt it, and upgrade it, provided that you are the database owner.

target.mrk: You can shut down that database, encrypt it, and upgrade it, provided that you are the database owner.

trans-unit.source: You can create your own SQL objects and write data to your own tables, provided that your coarse-grained connection authorization has not been set to readOnlyAccess.

seg-source.mrk: You can create your own SQL objects and write data to your own tables, provided that your coarse-grained connection authorization has not been set to readOnlyAccess.

target.mrk: You can create your own SQL objects and write data to your own tables, provided that your coarse-grained connection authorization has not been set to readOnlyAccess.

trans-unit.source: You can access other SQL objects, provided that the owners have granted you fine-grained SQL access to those objects, and provided you have not been limited by coarse-grained readOnlyAccess.

seg-source.mrk: You can access other SQL objects, provided that the owners have granted you fine-grained SQL access to those objects, and provided you have not been limited by coarse-grained readOnlyAccess.

target.mrk: You can access other SQL objects, provided that the owners have granted you fine-grained SQL access to those objects, and provided you have not been limited by coarse-grained readOnlyAccess.

trans-unit.source: The distinction between fine-grained SQL authorization and coarse-grained connection authorization is described in <xref href="cdevcsecure36595.dita#cdevcsecure36595"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: The distinction between fine-grained SQL authorization and coarse-grained connection authorization is described in <xref href="cdevcsecure36595.dita#cdevcsecure36595"></xref>.

target.mrk: The distinction between fine-grained SQL authorization and coarse-grained connection authorization is described in <xref href="cdevcsecure36595.dita#cdevcsecure36595"></xref>.
